newsitem.title: USA: Former Amre officers focus of lawsuit.
newsitem.headline: Former Amre officers focus of lawsuit.

text.p: Plaintiffs' attorneys said Monday they had filed a class action suit in U.S. District Court in New Jersey against certain former officers and directors of Amre Inc.

In a press release from the law firms Abbey, Gardy & Squitieri LLP and Harold Obstfeld PC, the attorneys said their complaint, filed on behalf of purchasers of Amre stock between April 29, 1996, and Jan. 16, 1997, alleges the defendants violated federal securities laws along with HFS Inc.

Amre, which ceased operations in January upon filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, had operated under the Century 21 Home Improvements brand name licensed to it by HFS. HFS terminated the license agreement in February.

The attorneys said the lawsuit alleges HFS controlled Amre's management and operations. The attorneys said they accuse HFS and former Amre officials of mispresenting and concealing material and adverse facts concerning Amre's ability to market home improvement products under the Century 21 brand name.
The attorneys also said prior to Amre's termination of operations, Amre insiders engaged in a massive sell off of their Amre common stock holdings.
